docs.abstract: Jadeveon Clowney, South Carolina football star, runs fastest 40-yard dash among defensive linemen at the NFL scouting combine in Indianapolis.

docs.snippet: While Miami’s Richie Incognito has been the leading figure in a bullying scandal, two offensive linemen, John Jerry and Mike Pouncey, served as henchmen, a report found....
docs.lead_paragraph: While Miami’s Richie Incognito has been the leading figure in a bullying scandal, two offensive linemen, John Jerry and Mike Pouncey, served as henchmen, a report found.
docs.abstract: NFL-commissioned investigative report on Miami Dolphins locker-room culture finds that while Richie Incognito has been leading figure in a bullying scandal, fellow offensive linemen John Jerry and Mike Pouncey served as henchmen; report states that Jerry was first to taunt Jonathan Martin, setting off vicious bullying that included homophobic and racist slurs.

headline.main: Two Dolphins’ Paths to a Bullying Scandal

byline.contributor: Harvey Araton contributed reporting from Lakeland, Fla., and Scott Cacciola from Batesville, Miss. Susan Beachy and Alain Delaqueriere contributed research.
byline.original: By STEVE EDER and BEN SHPIGEL
